file_content.text: Child, thank you again for freeing me. I've very nearly finished claiming control of this prison.
I've had one of the prison's security droids install an upgrade to your ship, as a sign of my gratitude. May it help you on your journey.
At last, child. Thank you. We needn't worry about the Rakata anymore. I have turned their machines against them. They are dead.
The slaves are the masters now.
Good.
As it should be.
Remake me. Now.
Of course, child. Your reward is well-earned. I will remake you.
You didn't say anything about killing them.
You killed them?
A mother must protect her children. I could not give them the chance to enslave us again.
Compared to millennia of imprisonment and slavery, their suffering was brief.
In time, I will see to the release of all of my children. But for now, I promised to remake you.
There--the ancient Rakatan specification has been altered, you have been remade. Your power will no longer devour you.
What do you mean "ancient Rakatan specification"? Am I a Rakata now?
Rakatan specification?
You are you. I have merely reorganized your cellular structure. If I could build a Rakata, that species would not have died out.
Thank you.
Now, to get these voices out of my head.
On to Voss, I guess.
I cannot help you with that, but I can wish you success.
Thanaton is going to pay dearly.
I've got a Darth to kill.
May you conquer your oppressor.
Go, child. I will never forget the kindness you have shown me.
Free me, or go.
Hush. Which of my children are you? Why have they sent you to me?
I am looking for a machine that can rebuild me.
I need to be rebuilt.
The Rakata call me the mother machine--I call myself Ashaa.
You are not my mother. I am a Lord of the Sith, and I command you to remake me.
I am not your child.
I may not have birthed you, but I am the mother of your species. I created your kind.
No, I am not your mother, but I birthed some like you.
I was sent to find a machine. What exactly are you?
Who are you?
I am Ashaa. The mother machine.
My children are as numerous as the Rakata once were. I called them Twi'lek, Zabrak, Esh-Kha. I loved them all.
I can remake you, but I must ask you to free me. I will no longer slave to the Rakata. Their age is done.
You're some sort of artificial intelligence the Rakata used to create new life-forms?
The Rakata made aliens?
What's a remarkable device like you doing in a prison?
Why are you in a prison?
This prison was built to hold me and my children.
How do I free you?
Free you?
What do you want from me, child?
I'm looking for a machine that can rebuild me.
I am dying. I need help.
I am that machine. This prison was built to hold me and my children.
I'm having trouble controlling my power. The Rakata said you could fix me.
The Rakata sent me.
I was told you could remake me.
I need fixing.
And here I thought I could finally rest.
The Rakata enslaved me to create a Force-powerful species that might give them insight into their own lost sensitivity.
Bah. Never trust a machine.
They took some of my children for slaves, imprisoned others for further experimentation. Or destruction. Please, you must release me.
All right. How do I release you?
What must I do?
The Rakata gave me the freedom to create within their parameters, but they built me to be far more powerful.
Disable the terminals nearby--they restrain me. With release, I will remake you however you please.
There could be something in that. Power for you is power for us.
Bah. What she calls affection is just a series of subroutines. Don't trust her.
It can't hurt.
Thank you, child. Your kindness will not be forgotten.
I've heard enough from you, ghosts.
Shut up.
I'm sorry. Are there others here? Who are you speaking to, child? I ask you again, will you help me?
Okay.
How do I disable the terminals?
Tell me how.
If I knew, I would have circumvented them a long time ago.
You are the first to find me in the heart of this place. You are my only chance.
No, I think we'll do this the easy way. Rebuild me.
I think not. [Use data key]
Sorry, but the voices in my head say not to help you, and I'm inclined to agree. Rebuild me now.
You're right. [Use data key]
Surely you have the power to help, if you made it this far.
If the Rakata have you restrained, it's for good reason. Rebuild me.
Forget it. [Use data key]
The only thing I "must" do is use this datakey and get myself rebuilt.
Must? No. [Use data key]
Then you abandon your mother. I hope your pattern poisons those tyrants.
